function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Lack of understanding of disease agent life cycles in urban settings","Impact":"Failure to effectively mitigate disease propagation in built environments","Mitigation":"Increased research and understanding of disease agents in urban settings","Technologies":"Surveillance and monitoring technology, research tools for disease agents","People":"Urban residents, workers, and visitors","Owner":"Research institutions, public health organizations"},{"Description":"Inadequate consideration of water feature design in urban areas","Impact":"Increased risk of waterborne diseases and toxic algae proliferation","Mitigation":"Incorporation of design elements to impede pathogen growth, and make water features less attractive to disease-carrying animals","Technologies":"Water treatment technology, pathogen detection systems","People":"Residents and visitors of urban areas","Owner":"Urban planners, landscape architects"},{"Description":"Unsuitable selection of tree species in highly populated areas","Impact":"Elevated pollen concentrations and increased allergic disease burden","Mitigation":"Thoughtful selection of tree species to minimize pollen concentrations","Technologies":"Pollen monitoring technology, allergy management tools","People":"Allergic residents in highly populated areas","Owner":"Urban planning authorities, environmental agencies"}]}
